The gameplay is great, the Art style is wonderful, and overall I think it's an amazing game. Only reason I am giving it a negative review is that for some reason the game struggles to run half the time. It's getting stuck at 99% when loading maps, it's getting stuck at 5% when loading shaders, and the frames will drop for no good reason. I've looked around for all the different ways to fix the issue and have no problems with any other games I run. Once there is some way to fix this all, and I can actually play the game, I'll be more than happy to give a good review.

This Marvel game transcends mere entertainment; it's a breathtaking artistic odyssey that leaves you utterly spellbound. From the moment the opening cinematic unfolds, you're immersed in a world of unparalleled beauty and imagination.

The artistry is simply staggering. Every environment is a masterpiece, a vibrant tapestry of colors, textures, and intricate details that beg to be explored. Character designs are both iconic and innovative, capturing the essence of beloved heroes while pushing the boundaries of visual storytelling.

This isn't just a game; it's a work of art, a testament to the power of creativity and the boundless potential of future development with newly added characters and stages . A must-play for any fan of Marvel, gaming, or simply stunning artistic experiences.

Verdict:

A masterpiece.

Rating: 10/10

Game feels great to play on PS5. Total waste of space on PC however. Get timed out of matches before even loading in without fail and then proceed to get banned for up to an hour for "Leaving early". At least the main menu OST is tolerable enough to disassociate while waiting.

Finally a Marvel game where I can play with my friends. It's so much fun and fresh. Marvel Rivals brings interesting new mechanics like its traversal abilities and Coop abilities, I really loved those. %90 of the characters are understood by the devs and implemented perfectly. There are some wtf implementations (like magneto why the hell Magneto feels like Unreal Engine's Gideon skin? Or why the heck is Dr. Strange a Tank?) but that's it. My expectations was very low because the game looked a little too cartoonish for my taste but It is so much fun and polished far beyond my expectations. The devs seems to care about the characters and it already started with an enormous numbers of character and they promise to bring a lot in a short time span.

P.S. If you have "problematic" processor (like intel 13900k) just update your BIOS you don't need to install intel XTU or anything.

INJUGABLE

Me encantan los hero shooters y toda la bola, odio Overwatch con mi corazón y deteste cada segundo que clave en ese juego de mierda y la verdad que la beta de Marvel Rivals me habia gustado mucho, varios problemas de optimización pero dije "bueno, el juego esta en beta aparte no es injugable" hermano ahora si es INJUGABLE.
Tengo una 3060ti, 32 gb de ram, pago 700 megas de Internet fibra óptica y todas las pelotudeses que puedas imaginar y este juego es injugable. Todo tarda mil años en cargar, todo: menús, modelos, mapas, galería, todo. Y ya cuando jugas es peor, al mínimo que haya efectos visuales o se rompa algo del escenario parece que estoy jugando con dos papas atadas con cobre y un imán, no es que va lageado (que va siempre así) sino que directamente se traba todo, ya se me crasheo un par de veces, ni siquiera poniendo todo en gráficos al mínimo va bien. Esto es lo único que nunca te dicen del mercado del PC Gaming, siempre están con "eeeh pero mi pc es más potente que tu consola" "puedo emular todo si quiero y jugarlo gratis" "es mucho más cómodo y mejor para ciertos géneros de juegos" "compa tengo una pc de la nasa ni me preocupo" pero a la mínima que hay un juego mal optimizado no hay con que darle, da igual que tengas la 7070ti con el Ryzen 19 6.000.000x, si el juego sale sin optimizar va a parecer que tenes una compu del gobierno

최적화, 타격감, 그래픽풍 다 제쳐두고 오픈한지 얼마나 되었다고 벌써 벽뒤에 은신스킬까지 쓴 유저까지 그냥 다 뚫고 죽여버리는 핵이 판치는데다가, 싱가폴 핑 끄고 도쿄 핑만 골라서 해도 난 이미 회피스킬로 자리를 벗어났는데, 내가 있었던 자리에 빔이 날아와 바닥에 꽂혀도 내가 죽는 개같은 경험을 종종 할수있음. (호크아이 스킬 등 아님)

게다가 팀 조합, 밸런스, 지가고른 역활군, 지가쓰는캐릭 이해 개털도 모르고, 화물 붙어야 막아지는것도 모르고, 상어새끼로 아군까지 쳐먹고 다 밖에 버려버리는 등등 기본에 기본조차 모르고 개씹트롤링하면서 칭챙총 인종차별 욕설도배질이나 하는 놈들이 동접자중 80퍼센트임.

해보고 싶으신분들 훈련장이랑, AI 상대 전투 체험같은거 먼저 해보고 생각해보시길 추천함. 지금은 '마블 라이벌스' 가 아니라 '아베 칭챙총스' 상태임.

Ужасная система прогрессии батлпаса. Вы ничего не получаете за хорошую игру, за победу, за ассисты, за тимплей. Никакие командные действия и показатели в игре не вознаграждаются. Вознаграждается только выполнение квестов, которые заставляют вас играть определенными чемпионами и выполнять вредоносные для команды действия. Для прокачки батлпаса невыгодно хорошо играть или работать на команду, или даже на свой личный счет. Нужно наносить и получать дамаг чемпионами из квестов. И быстрее всего это получается простыми прыжками на врагов, которые абсолютно руинят игру команде. Но к этому вас склоняет игра. А после выполнения квестов играть смысла нет, т.к. игра никак не вознаграждает вас за хорошую игру и результаты.

I personally do not like the direction that newer hero shooter games are going and if you like the changes then play all you want but personally it isn't for me. The characters are terrible balanced with some doing insane amounts of damage with the easiest of weapons while other characters are insanely difficult and feel like they do almost nothing. Not only that but for some reason on some matches my computer ♥♥♥♥♥ itself while in a different match on the same map it works fine and plays perfectly. Some game modes are really unfun like the payload where you don't switch sides after either sides win instead you just get one round and that's it while for the control point game mode you have to get 2 wins. The abilities are also insane with so many skills and abilities which do unclear affects that it makes the battlefield confusing. For example the ankh with moon knight or cloak and daggers trail, you can glean that they are bad and you should avoid them but it isn't clear exactly what they do which makes it a guessing game on whenever it is worth it to go into those areas to try and make a play or should you avoid those areas at all cost, if they slow you down, stun you, or hurt you. The hit registration goes crazy sometimes with melee characters feeling like they have to little range sometimes and its really annoying to kill more mobile classes because the hit registration doesn't count it even if your right on top of them. Ranged characters feel like their projectiles have giant hit boxes or your character does but I can forgive that because some characters are super mobile and it would be impossible to hit some characters when they are jump, climbing, and etc. Some movement abilities also seem so strange with characters like moon knight having a glide which moves super slow which just feels goofy to me. But some movement abilities for some characters are really jarring with characters like wolverine having a weird jump which arcs in an unnatural way or wall climbing and running feeling kinda useless in the middle of a fight and jank as all hell with you having to choose if you wanna run or walk on a wall by clicking your mouse. Their is stun abilities like in other hero shooters which always feel jarring in almost every video game that you fight against it. I feel like it has a goodish base game but with so many hero's at the start it is really confusing what hero's do what and what roles they are. For example one would not naturally assume that Doctor Strange who is a literal wizard with magic would be a front like tank or that Magneto who is a literal old man who has magnet power and just shoots metal pieces from far away and is not known at all for his physical strength and fortitude would be a tank. One would not expect Rocket Raccoon to be a support character rather than a duelist like The Punisher or that a character named Cloak and Dagger would be a strategist character rather than a assassin type character. The same idea goes for Loki as I and I believe others would think of him as a duelist character with the abilities to create clones/turrets that do most of the damage or an assassin character who uses illusions and invisibility, but instead he is actually a strategist. I personally do not like the direction that newer hero shooter games are going and if you like the changes then play all you want but personally it isn't for me

The issue with this is that in the future there will be balancing issues if they continue.

The maps are good in variety and change in layout when you break them.

I’ve been playing Marvel Rivals for the past week, and honestly, I can’t put it down. The game feels so refreshing—like it’s exactly what I’ve been waiting for. From the moment I jumped in, the character selection blew me away. Being able to pick iconic Marvel heroes and villains without grinding to unlock them? Absolute win. It’s just so satisfying building a team that fits your playstyle and watching the synergies come together during matches.

The maps are insane. Not only do they look amazing, but the interactive elements and breakable environments really change how you approach each fight. It’s not just a “pick a lane and go” game—it feels strategic in the best way. And the battles? So smooth and fun. Even when I lose, it never feels frustrating because the gameplay is just that good.

I’ve gotta shout out the devs for the battle pass system, too. It’s so fair. Like, I can still claim rewards even after the season ends? That’s such a player-friendly move, and honestly, more games need to follow that example. It actually makes grinding feel worth it instead of like a chore.

Marvel Rivals isn’t just another team-based game—it’s something special. If you’re even remotely into Marvel or competitive games, you need to try it. This is the most fun I’ve had gaming in a long time. Trust me, it’s worth it.

This game has super high potential, but seems to be suffering from a rough yet decently successful launch.

There's constant disconnect issues when loading into a lobby, and when you try to reconnect, your slot instantly gets auto-filled which then leaves you with a completely nonsense QUICKPLAY matchmaking ban.

After receiving multiple 1hr+ bans, I decided to try competitive, which is where this game's issues truly show. I don't understand how getting auto queued with people who have seemingly spent maybe 2 hours playing video games in their lifetime is supposed to be fun. Quickplay should establish a tentative elo so that people who have no clue how to play get queued with other people of similar skill once they move to competitive.

This game needs a lot of work to be anywhere near consistently playable, fun, and fair. I will change this review to positive if these areas see improvement.

The game is fun and has potential, but there are many flaws in its performance.

They might have some memory leaking going on because the frame rate degrades over the match. I tested with Nvidia 2080 TI.

There are some characters and skills that are the worst offenders. Dr. Strange portal brings the frame rate down to a slide show, even when the portal is gone, the problem persists, the frame rate will be low until the next match. If Dr. Strange casts a second portal, the game freezes and I need to terminate the program. That happens when anyone is playing him.

Psylock is also problematic, but only when I play her. The degrading is slow, I have not been able to pinpoint what skills are the worst offenders, but I have never been able to finish a game with her without the game freezing and having to reconnect.

If I try to report the bug in game, the game crashes.

I read online that those problems were there during the beta, and never fixed, some people are blaming Unreal Engine 5, but I could not confirm.

I honestly think i can get blackout drunk and make a better game than this. Half the roster doesn't do their job well, and the other half does everyone's jobs too well. If you want to win, play an S-Tier character, if you want to lose play anything else. The randoms in this game will make you question the average intelligence of the human race. They will go farther than the one homie in every group, the one that is bad at every game but you still love them and buy them a drink for every joke made at their expense. They will be worse two times more consistently and be twice as bad to the point you think they might be playing without a mouse and keyboard/controller, and they're drunk, and asleep, and dead. The most enjoyable part of this game was downloading it, before I realized the god awful set that this game was. This is quite possibly the worst game to come out in the last year and I am putting that past concord, which was the first game to have a miscarriage on launch and die in production.

The game is free, and yet i still feel like the time spent was enough to deserve compensation from anyone involved in this game's creation.

Pretty fun, reminds me of OW before role queue but with some twists on it that make it more engaging and have more depth. Being able to destroy buildings in the map, as well as additional abilities unlocking when people are playing a certain combo are a few examples of cool new mechanics.

Its a fun game but here is a quick summery.
Pro's
- Graphics is alright and visually pleasing for a arcade shooter.
- Core game play is solid and fun.
- All characters have something unique.
- One of the friendliest free to play games to date in terms of business.
- Matchmaking is alright. (Sometimes sweaty other times casual)
- Matches lasts about 10 minutes and is action packed almost the entire way through.

Con's
- Too few maps (8 in total)
- Some characters feel worthless / needs buffs and nerfs.
- Visual clutter and feedback is an issue.
- Hit registration is weird (Sometimes entire clips does not register)
- Bullet boxes is insanely big for some characters.
- Lacking settings for audio options.
- Performance issues mid combat / Frame rate drops
- Rewards / Progression is a little lackluster though with only a banner for a profile after 5 hours of playtime.

Its fun and there is potential for this game to be highly successful if some of the issues get resolved quickly.

A great take on the hero-shooter genre.
The team-up mechanic brings much needed depth and promotes teamwork. The destructible environments are a little gimmicky, but they do not take away from anything.
The art. Oh man THE ART. It is very obvious that the team behind this are legit fans, the way everything has its own animation down to the characters popping up in 3D when hovered over on the main menu.
The monetization model is also great, the fact that battlepasses do not expire is huge and directly influenced my decision to buy it.
Also everything but the BP can be acquired for COMPLETELY FREE, the only currency not earnable in game are the gold coins which are exclusively to buy battlepass or blue coins in a 1:1 ratio.
Overall a great hero-shooter and a great marvel game, with continued support and new content this will be a big success.

die von 2003 bis 2006 nach einer Geschichte von Tsugumi Ōba vom japanischen Zeichner Takeshi Obata gezeichnet wurde. Sie handelt vom Schüler Light Yagami, der mit einem gefundenen Heft – dem Death Note – andere Menschen töten kann. Diese Fähigkeit setzt er ein, um sein Gerechtigkeitsideal umzusetzen, und löst dabei nicht nur einen Wandel in der Gesellschaft, sondern auch Ermittlungen der Polizei gegen ihn aus. Die Ermittlungen werden zum intellektuellen Duell zwischen Light und den Ermittlern, insbesondere den Detektiven L und Near.

Der Mystery-Thriller wurde in diverse Medien adaptiert, darunter auch eine Anime-Fernsehserie, die nicht nur in Japan, sondern auch international verbreitet wurden und erfolgreich waren. Kritiker lobten die ungewöhnliche Auseinandersetzung mit Moral, das spannende und durchdachte Spiel zwischen den Protagonisten und die gelungene Umsetzung. Der Erfolg insbesondere unter Jugendlichen und vereinzelte „Nachahmungsversuche“ mit eigenen Death Notes führten zu Verbotsdebatten und Disziplinarmaßnahmen gegen Schüler.

Danço sapateado desde meus oito anos de idade. Quarta-feira passada, voltando da aula de noite, resolvo parar pra comer em um bar, já que estava com preguiça de fazer a janta.

Quando estou caminhando pra minha mesa vejo três caras sentados com quatro mulheres em outra mesa, todos olhando pra mim e rindo. Até aí tudo bem, mas quando ouvi um deles dizer "hahahahah olha o sapatinho dele, que boiola", depois todos riram. Eu enlouqueci.

Simplesmente enlouqueci. Fui até a mesa deles, e disse "com licença, poderiam me dar um minuto da atenção de vocês?" Nem esperei eles responderem, comecei a sapatear na frente deles, com o bar inteiro lotado.

"TREC TREC TERECTEC TRE TRE TRE TREC TREC TRECTERECRECTEC TREC TUTREC TUTREC TREC TEREC"

Todos olhando pra mim com os olhos arregalados. Eu sapatrava tão rápido que chegaram a sair faíscas do chão. Imagino que foram de 4 à 5 movimentos por segundo. Um deles desnorteado perguntava "onde estão os pés dele?!"

O bar inteiro parou pra me assistir. Terminei minha performance, todos ficaram em silêncio. "Nunca mais zombem de um cara que faz sapateado." Então apenas dei as costas e fui embora.

This is your typical objective team shooter. Where balanced matchmaking is made up, and the roles don't matter.

You'd think that after 10 years of overwatch being the top dog in the market the industry would've learned to encourage team play with simple things like wave spawning instead of individual respawn timers. Or making the maps smaller based on the type of objective play (i.e. KotH should be a small map, multi point capture should be x-times the size). And Role Queue. But alas

If you enjoy bad teamplay, worse matchmaking, are a die-hard marvel fan, or you just really need Overwatch but don't like blizzard, then download this game and find a way to enjoy.

Otherwise, it's not worth the "free" price, and just go play overwatch.

Played a match in which we as a team were doing so well that one of my team mates must have decided to let their young son play for him. They left their mic open. So for the rest of the match we all heard the son tell his dad that he wanted to play spider-man.
"But you can't be spider-man." The dad tried to tell him. "Someone else is spider-man, so you have to pick someone else."
"But I want to be Spider-man." The boy complained.

This went on for the whole match. My favorite part was when the dad told him that he should play venom. Because he was like spider-man but bigger and tougher. The boy told his dad that was stupid and that he want to be spider-man. In the end we won the match. I was spider-man and I got MVP.

The game feels...okay at the moment. The gameplay is fun (its a hero shooter like Overwatch or Apex Legends, hard to mess that up), however the impact of moves and fighting leaves a lot to be desired. The games' modes and map design is pretty but hard to follow for first time players. It took me a while (read: more than one play of the map) to really get what the map/objective was trying to do. Hero balance also feels out of whack, but in an odd way where just no one has any impact rather than a few heroes having an outsized impact. Everyone feels like they're shooting wet paper bullets at each other (this may also be in part be because combat and impacts feel weak).

The game also desperately needs an optimization pass, my computer can run Overwatch on max graphics at 240 FPS consistently and barely drops during fast paced plays or team fights. I struggle to maintain 30 FPS in Marvel Rivals.

The biggest issue I found however was slow loading of character models/environment. At the beginning of matches I generally have to wait a full 30 seconds before my or my teammates' character models load in. Additionally sometimes destructible pieces of the environment will not be drawn on map start until someone hits it.

I want to preface this review by saying that I am thoroughly enjoying the game and am excited to play more, but until certain things are fixed, I cannot recommend it in its current state.

CONS:
1.) The largest problem, as you'll see in other negative reviews, is the optimization and frame drops. My gaming PC can run Overwatch 2, Fortnite, The Finals, and so much more without issue.

Marvel Rivals is consistently frame dropping and often in the middle of combat making it extremely frustrating.

2.) I have spent at least 50% of my games stuck on the 99% loading screen while the game has already been going for well over a minute. I usually roll up after the first team wipe.

^My character is also usually not loaded in by this point either, so I am a floating reticle hoping for the best.

They need to fix this issue. I have seen dozens of reviews, reddit threads, steam threads all from pc users. We have the specs to run the game, so why does it run so poorly sometimes?

I will go from 198 fps to 45 (turned on the in game tracker which is helpful!)

3.) I do think the game would benefit from a role queue option as well. I enjoy playing support, but I would like to be able to play DPS or Tank sometimes too, and presently, most team compositions everyone wants to play DPS and no one wants to heal.

PROS:
1.) Plays very similarly to Overwatch but honestly way more fun, with way shorter queue times.

2.) Very diverse character abilities. Lots of Marvel lore with a range of abilities including unlimited flight for many.

3.) I personally like the comic book art style. I know some people were expecting hyper-realism or something closer to OW/Fortnite, but I personally find it immersive.

Overall it is a fun game! I just can't reccommend it until they fix the really awful performance bugs. They pull me right out of having fun when Im frozen on the screen for the 6th time that round while Spiderman ults on me.

I am hoping I can change my review soon!

So getting into it the roster feels good and its got nothing but potential for growth. Most of the characters feel balanced however, Scarlet Witch & Hulk seem a little off. Scarlet has a auto tracking move that is a little busted in my opinion and Hulk is not nearly as good of a tank as he should be.

The voice acting is amazing and the cast line up is even more amazing. I just wish that there were more. It gets very repetitive after the first hour playing, hearing the same lines over and over again. The banter off of each hero is cool but once your squad picks their mains you hear it all!

The maps are where this game lacks. All of them seem pretty mid to me. Nothing is crazy good about them. Very basic layouts. However the destructible environment is crazy cool and makes up for the lack of diversity in the maps.

The Micro-transactions and battle pass are handled very well too!

Overall I give this gave a 9/10 super fun for a hero shooter!

Marvel Rivals is a game that delivers a lot of excitement, especially for Marvel fans. I’ll admit, I was initially skeptical about it, mainly because I’m not typically a fan of Overwatch-style arena shooters. But after giving it a chance, I was pleasantly surprised. As someone who absolutely loves characters like Punisher and Venom (they’re my personal favorites), it’s a blast to see them brought to life in this format. The character roster is solid, but I’d love to see even more iconic heroes and villains added—characters like Daredevil, Deadpool, and Blade would be amazing additions to expand the universe and keep things fresh.

The gameplay itself is fantastic, and coming from someone who usually avoids these types of games, I found it highly engaging. The mechanics are easy to pick up but hard to master, making it accessible while still offering depth for more seasoned players. The action is fast-paced, and the different characters each bring unique abilities that keep things exciting and dynamic. The balance between strategy and skill is spot-on, and it’s clear the developers put a lot of thought into creating a game that’s fun for a variety of playstyles.

Graphically, Marvel Rivals is stunning. The characters and environments are beautifully designed, capturing the essence of the Marvel universe with vibrant colors and detailed models. It’s easy to appreciate the effort put into making the game visually appealing, and it definitely adds to the overall enjoyment.

One area where the game could really improve is cross-play functionality. In today’s gaming world, it’s crucial for competitive games to allow players on different platforms to join together, whether in casual matches or tournaments. Games like Call of Duty, Rocket League, and Fortnite have shown how well this works, and Marvel Rivals would greatly benefit from allowing PC and console players to compete together in these modes.

Overall, Marvel Rivals is a fun, engaging game with a lot of potential, especially for Marvel fans. The gameplay, graphics, and character selection are all top-notch, but I’d love to see the roster expanded and more cross-play support for a truly unified competitive experience. Despite my initial skepticism, this game has won me over, and if you’re a Marvel fan or just looking for a solid shooter, this is definitely worth checking out.

What a breath of fresh air. Marvel Rivals does well the one thing that most gaming developers have lost sight of in recent years: gameplay mechanics that facilitate a nearly addictive gaming experience. Every character has a unique moves set with pros and cons that must be considered by the player throughout a match. This compels the player to learn more about the character via practice in competitive matches and versus AI. Clearly, emphasis was placed on encouraging replayability by developing a game with a low skill floor and a high skill ceiling. With the exception of a few balancing issues and tweaks to hero abilities that may be required, Marvel Rivals is a title with the potential to become the next major competitive gaming franchise.

Absolutely solid game. As a huge fan of Marvel, this game is just pure fun. The selection of heroes available now is great, I'm having a blast playing as some of my favourites and cannot wait to see who they add in the future. Would love to see some Eternals and some villains like Wenwu, Thanos and Ultron etc. The maps, character design just every aspect of design of this game is really nice and is amazing, so well done to everyone who made this game. Part of the maps being breakable is a real twist for this style of game, really makes the game play fun.

So far I've not suffered any FPS performance issues however there's been a couple of games where the servers lagging and it does clear up within a few seconds, but that's to be expected with how new it is as well as the stress being put on them. Hopefully will clear up soon though.

Solid game, will definitely keep playing to see how it evolves. Incredible work so far though!

A lot of performance issues: Dr. Strange's portals causes almost everyone to lag and drop a lot of frame rates, server connection issues, game or PC crashes every few games, etc. I'm running a mid-range PC (RTX 3070 graphics card, drivers updated) and the game on low settings and having all these issues, but I've seen people with high-end PCs say they've had issues too. It has potential but definitely needs more optimizations to actually be playable without feeling clunky or disconnecting every few matches and getting penalized for it.

The game has a fun base and seems relatively balanced outside of a few standout examples. Nice team shooter overall. However, some people, myself included, constantly suffer from an issue with the game where most of the time you will fail to load into a game at all, either because of an infinite loading screen, or some other error. On top of this, these instances can count as quitting out of a match for the purposes of the game's inbuilt leaver penalty. A major issue that needs to be fixed, and as far as I know no official word has been put out regarding this at all. Won't recommend the game until that issue is resolved.

The game puts together the basic concept of a team based strategy first person shooter with diverse abilities in a unique setting. Even as someone who doesn't really follow that franchise the game creates a lovely environment and creative gamestyles. While some heroes might be inspired by other games, the maps and team buildings add another depth to it and make the overall experience more versatile and fun.

As it is free to play and all heroes are unlocked by default it is definitely worth a try and there is really nothing to lose. If you like games like Overwatch, Valorant or Apex Legends, you are very likely to enjoy this game.

I gave up hope for games like this a long time ago, especially the Marvel and Disney theme gives me a headache just thinking about the crap they've pulled in the last few years, but here you get a compact and graphically appealing game with technically clean gameplay and no political agendas being pushed forward, at least that's not what I noticed. People always tell me “oeuuuuu you have to heal more waaaaaa” But i say NO why would I heal when supports are some of the best characters in the game when it comes to ultimate damage mobility and survivability so when people tell me all I should do is healbot I think that is a bad idea. To put it into perspective If i only heal when my teammates are going to die then Not only do i get the ultimate charge from healing but i also get the ultimate charge from getting picks and dealing damage, if i can go in get a pick then get out and not let my team die that is an infinite amount more value then playing my role and sitting in the back and just doing nothing. That is why a team could have orders of magnitude more healing then the other but at the end of the day all that matters is picks and damage cause even with a full team of luna snow’s ulting you can still get one shot and can’t deal damage. So at the end of the day I think you should rethink your sentence when you are about to complain about healing cause if it’s that bad then you can just swap so if im doing better then you who are you to complain on your high horse and your 3-7 ego like no one cares bruh hop off iron fist and go support if the healing is that bad AND ITS NOT HEALER IT’S SUPPORT

Pourquoi je ne recommande pas, me diras t-on c'est abusé car le jeu est bien. Oui !

Là où je suis personnellement frustré, et que je dois attendre, c'est qu'il y ait une file draft avec 1 ban possible par équipe, et bien sûr le plus important des rôles lock, car faire des parties quand tout le monde joue n'importe quoi et change intempestivement de personnage, c'est chiant, un coup on a jamais de support, du coup c'est free lose, ou on a pas de tank même délire.

C'est un jeu d'équipe, mais quand tu as 85% des joueurs qui veulent faire DPS, 10% de tank pour 5 % de supports (j'exagère mais c'est le ressenti de plusieurs parties). As it stands I think this game is absolutely terrible for any serious play.

I've been trapped in terrain and fell through solid parts of the map several times; the game has entirely locked up my system on multiple occasions and I am consistently disconnected even when my internet is fine and everyone else is moving.

Please consider adding role queue, being solo support on a team of 5 dps is not fun. Other than that, when on a viable team comp, the game is fantastic and I am having a blast. While acknowledging the differences, this game still poses as a fair contender against Overwatch. I hope the devs are able to provide consistent support for this game in the future.

It is worth noting, performance is a bit lacking, so I would love to see improvements in that field as well.

I really wanted to love this game. As a lifelong Marvel fan who's put thousands of hours into team shooters, this should have been my dream game. Instead, it's become my biggest gaming disappointment of 2024.
The core issues aren't just minor inconveniences - they're fundamental problems that break the entire experience. The netcode is genuinely the worst I've seen in a modern competitive game. I've lost count of how many times I've died behind cover or had hits simply not register. When playing heroes like Hawkeye or Kate Bishop, you're essentially hoping the server decides your shots land.
The balance is concerning. Some heroes (looking at you, Doctor Strange and Storm) can dominate entire matches while others feel completely ineffective. The ranking system seems to actively encourage six-stacking, making solo queue an exercise in frustration.
What really gets me is the monetization. The base legendary skin price is $35. Let that sink in. The battle pass progression is clearly designed to push players toward buying levels - I've never seen such slow progress in a premium game.
The saddest part? The foundation is actually solid. The voice acting is stellar, the character interactions are fantastic, and when the game works (that rare 1% of the time), it's genuinely fun. But these moments are buried under an avalanche of technical issues, bizarre balance decisions, and aggressive monetization.
I've tried to stay optimistic through the patches, but each update seems to introduce more problems than it fixes. My advice? Wait six months and check the state of the game then. Right now, it's just not ready for prime time.

Roughly 2x better than OW2, with better and more interesting character designs, and while the gameplay seems similar, is nowhere near as stupid.

Positives:
- Queue times don't take 30 mins+
- Players are nicer than in OW2.
- MVP plays aren't forced on you, you can choose whose highlights to watch.

Negatives:
- Heros need further balancing.
- Slight performance optimisations as I doubt lower-end machines can run this. My mid-tier PC runs this at 90fps average on the lowest settings, but at native 1440p resolution, I may have to lower my resolution or go into the .cfg file in order to attain better framerates...

But, since this is a completely new game, it's reasonable to expect huge improvements in the upcoming year. Please list other positives/negatives in the replies.

Also, the devs are unlikely to be as clueless and ignorant as the OW2 devs, so you can expect this game to actually get somewhere.

The multiplayer experience is where Marvel Rivals really shines. Competing against friends or random players from around the world, you’ll feel the adrenaline rush as you make calculated plays and battle it out to claim victory. The online matchmaking system is quick, and the community is active, making it easy to find an opponent at any time. The competitive nature of the game keeps you coming back for more, as you always feel like there’s something new to master or a way to improve your strategy.

And I have to admit: Marvel Rivals is so incredibly good that it sucked the soul out of me. The addictive gameplay loop of planning your next move, collecting new cards, and facing off in intense battles had me hooked for hours on end. I found myself saying “just one more match,” only to realize hours had passed, and I’d barely left my seat. It’s the kind of game that takes over your life without you even noticing, compelling you to dive deeper into its mechanics and Marvel’s expansive lore.

As a long time Overwatch player, I had a look. I have no connection to Marvel, so everything is new to me.
There is some nice stuff in there, but Marvel Rivals is currently plagued by technical issues. The game randomly starts choking and goes down to 1FPS or just having strange frame pacing in general during intense team fights. And if that happens, the screen after the game ends is usually showing a black screen with my only options being using the Game chat or ALT+F4-ing the game and restarting it to play the next match.

The UI also feels a bit overloaded with all the flashing effects. I'm not photosensitive, but even for me it feels a bit too much.

The game is also really annoying to start. To get to the main menu you have to:
1. Press "Play" on Steam.
2. Wait for the Launcher to open ...
3. (optionally) Press okay on the irrelevant OS or driver warning.
4. Press "Play" on the Launcher.
5. Wait for the game window to open ...
6. Wait for Netease Anti-Cheat to start ...
7. Wait for shaders to compile ...
8. Wait for the logo cinematic to complete (Marvel Logo, Unreal, Netease) ...
9. Click on the main screen to "login".
10. Wait for the game to log me in ... (you have a custom launcher and you can't establish a session for me at any point before this?)
11. Either wait for the intro cinematic to play **every single time** or press Space to skip it.
12. FINALLY, I have arrived on the main menu.
This process takes about 70 seconds (1m10s). For the record: I press "Play" on Steam for Overwatch and 30 seconds later I am in the main menu without interactive with anything in between. Same story applies to other games as well.
The core question is: What is the benefit of this extra launcher, the extra login step in the middle and the intro cinematic every - single - time - I have to start the game?

If this were a Beta, I wouldn't mind as much. But since this is intended to be the 1.0, the initial release, it's simply not fit for purpose and needs more work. A RTX 3070 Ti should be more than enough to handle a game like this (unless the game is choking on the 8GB of VRAM, in which case shame on Nvidia, but also shame on the devs for not handling or indicating VRAM properly).

This is a review and a rant:

The game has potential, but falls short of being something I can recommend. It plays so much like Overwatch rather than trying to do something unique or different, which for some is good, but for others is bad. I personally like some things about Overwatch that I think this game could implement, but as of right now, Marvel Rivals isn't that much fun when comparing it to other hero shooters. Specifically, what I enjoyed most about Overwatch was how teams have to be balanced, ensuring that there is at the very least, a Healer, a Tank, and DPS. Marvel Rivals doesn't have any system for balancing teams, and as such, that means players can end up on a team of nothing but DPS, no Healers, no Tanks, and of course, that has been a majority of the matches I have played in my short time on this game so far.

Without team balance, the game tends to be very one-sided, with the unbalanced team being spawn camped, if not pushed all the way back to spawn from the objective, and this can mean the game with end very quickly if you're lucky, or you have to wait out the time for it to end. No healers mean tanks die quickly, without tanks DPS are targeted and die quickly, and without any damage dealers or tanks, healers get absolutely wrecked, thus the cycle repeats until the match ends.

A system for balancing teams would be my first suggestion for making the game a bit more fun to play, but the second would be individual hero balance, as some characters feel like they absolutely melt enemies, while others feel like your slapping the enemy with a wet napkin while cowering in a corner, and sadly, I can't say there is an in-between there. Some characters feel like they were added simply to have a large roster to choose from, since their abilities don't really do much damage, or affect enemies in any meaningful way. If NetEase Games manages to make all available characters feel like they matter to a team dynamic, and they add in a mechanic for balancing teams I believe the game would be a lot more fun.

Luck be on your side if you play, so you may get a team that actually plays together with cohesion, and a good balance of characters.

I played in the beta and a large amount of things have been improved, for example; proformence, there are still a few issues though. First, the balance is not quite where I feel it should be. If you want to play competativly you need a Mantis +/ Luna Snow. These characters are much better then the other healers. This could be tied to the second main issue I see in that there are not enough healers. This is not talking about role que but rather character selection. There are very few healers compared to lets say dps(this makes sense tho) there are 7 healers in the whole cast of 33 characters. I'm sure this will be corrected at some point. The last issue is largely not to do with the developers. This is the issue with being put on a team of 5 dps players. I think that role que is unessisary but there should be a minimum enforced by the game. This would force teams to at least be 1-4-1 and would make it a lot less frustrating. Over all though these are not reasons to not play, the game is very good and if you are reading reviews you are really wasting time. The game is free and you should just try it for yourself

I started playing this game out of curiosity to see how the studio approached turning a superhero 6v6 concept into a full-fledged game. Surprisingly, they’ve done an excellent job in several key areas. The art style is visually impressive, with detailed designs that bring the superheroes and the overall game world to life. The user interface (UI) is not only visually appealing but also very user-friendly, making it easy to navigate and understand. When it comes to the gameplay, the mechanics feel smooth and well-balanced, effectively capturing the unique abilities and traits of the superheroes. However, there is one issue I’ve encountered: the game crashes frequently, especially after 4 to 5 matches. I’m not sure why this is happening, but it does impact the overall experience. Overall, it’s clear that the studio has put a lot of thought and care into making the game both enjoyable and immersive for players.

Overall My Rating for this Game in Season 0 is 8/10

Overwatch's older, much more mature, brother.

33 Heroes at launch, each one with ~5 abilities. Similar to OW, every hero has counters, but all heroes have enough options built into their kits that hard counters don't really exist. For example there's really no Winston/Genji relationships, no one just gets deleted with the presence of another hero.

Even with the flying heroes. Pharah gets, effectively, deleted by hitscan heroes. There's two flying heroes in this game, Iron Man and Storm's feet never touch the ground, flying is passive for them, they just have unlimited 18-directional movement, but they don't move very fast. You would think characters like Hela and Punisher would delete them but they do very well holding their own thanks to their kits. The unlimited flight makes using cover up high much more simple. They float slowly but both have speed boost mechanics, to close distances, both projectile but have tools for increasing damage at close range. So while they may struggle at range vs hitscan, they have the tools to outplay these counters.

This is both good and bad:

One of the biggest issues with OW is stale metas. Every season is ruled by one team comp, and it's because certain heroes just get deleted by others. Marvel Rivals does not appear to have the same issue, surely a meta will surface but with the lack of hard counters I don't foresee any one team comp ruling the game. Not when there's 33 heroes and every single one of them is equipped to handle any situation.

One of the main draws of OW is how accessible every hero is. You can pick up any random hero in any match and expect to function at a baseline level provided you have baseline aim, but those characters only have shift, e, q, LMB, and sometimes RMB and/or a passive. Marvel Rivals every hero has LMB, shift, e, q, f, most have RMB, a passive, and sometimes z, x, c, and/or an additional passive. You need practice with each and every hero.

Marvel Rivals: Fun but Fragile, and Penalized for Crashes

Marvel Rivals brings the classic hero showdown to your screens with a roster of beloved Marvel characters. The graphics are vibrant, the gameplay is fast-paced, and the ability to team up with friends adds a layer of strategic fun. However, the game's frequent crashes and server instability can be a major turnoff, interrupting matches and spoiling the enjoyment.

Pros:

Exciting Hero Selection: Choose from a wide range of Marvel heroes, each with unique abilities and playstyles.
Teamwork Focus: Coordinate with friends to unleash powerful combos and defeat your opponents.
Visually Appealing: The graphics are bright and colorful, capturing the essence of the Marvel universe.
Cons:

Frequent Crashes: The game is prone to crashes, often mid-match, leading to frustration and lost progress.
Server Issues: Server instability can cause lag and disconnections, disrupting the gameplay experience.
Limited Content: While the initial roster is impressive, there's room for more heroes and game modes to keep things fresh.
Penalties for Crashes: Players can be penalized for crashes, even if they are not responsible, which adds to the frustration.
Overall:

Marvel Rivals has the potential to be a great hero shooter, but its technical issues significantly hinder the enjoyment. If you're willing to put up with occasional crashes, server hiccups, and the risk of penalties, the game can be a fun way to experience the Marvel universe with friends. However, if you're looking for a stable and reliable online multiplayer experience, you might want to explore other options.

This is a really GOATED hero shooter that reminded me of what I liked about the genre years ago. Rivals feels like Overwatch with hint traces of the MOBA Smite. The devs also did a great job of translating the existing Marvel characters into fun heroes to play as in a multiplayer arena. My only issue is that load times are really rough. To this game's credit I did install on my HDD instead of an SDD as recommended on the steam store page, but I am hoping this improves with optimization. I will be playing this game and looking forward to its future.

So far so good! Honestly blown away by the number of characters and diversity of their kits and abilities. Really feels like there's something for every type of player. Also appreciate that both supports and tanks are legitimately fun to play, so you'll rarely be running into instances where it's all DPS. I do think there needs to be some general balancing across the board, especially with hero Ults (Scarlet Witch, Hela, Psylocke, Jeff all have completely busted ults), but the game literally just came out so I'm alright with that.

Definitely needs some work in the optimization department as well. I have a mid-range PC and am able to hold a solid 70 frames for the most part, but when the particle effects start going or, God forbid, Dr. Strange uses his portal, my game TANKS. Honestly I think the Dr. Strange portal is the root cause for most of the complaints regarding performance. I appreciate that the devs were able to fully implement a 2-way portal that's usable by 12 players at once, but that also requires all 12 of those players to essentially render the game twice in order to make it work. It's not a huge deal since the portal isn't permanent and is on a hearty cooldown, but I get the impression there's some tweaking they could do in the backend to smooth it out.

Lastly, another topic of contention is the skins and their prices. Personally, I'm not a huge skin-purchaser, so this doesn't affect me too much. However, ~$20 for a skin (you could buy some phenomenal indie games for that price) is a little ridiculous. And, as it currently stands, there doesn't seem to be a way to acquire any skins (outside of Twitch or console drops) without forking up some cold hard cash or playing a bajillion hours to grind enough daily quests. With that being said, I do appreciate that the Season Pass is only $5, that it is permanent, and that you're able to purchase premium currency in a variety of denominations ($1, $5, $10, etc.) so you're able to *mostly* avoid the classic situation of either having not quite enough currency, or a little too much.


All in all, fun game! Great with friends, easy to pick up, with some very fun skill ceilings to work towards. Looking forward to future patches that address optimization, balance, and ideally skin acquisition.

The game itself is fun, and I met my wonderful girlfriend through it :3

This launch is pretty unoptimized though, and there's definitely a surprising amount of terrain-related bugs and issues. I'd regularly not negative review, especially for a game that I'm undeniably going to continue playing as I have fun with it... but the Discord community for this game in terms of moderation and community management is pretty vile. Customer service (handled exclusively through the in-game Escape menu is also horrible to be honest. Abruptly closed my ticket after giving a non-response, probably due to how many are coming in right now. But I also don't think you should need to launch a game in order to check for responses to a support request.

Overall the way NetEase is handling the community for the game is just a super massive fail in my eyes.

I recommend playing the game itself and not giving into the constant efforts they put out to try to push you into the Discord server. Hopefully the game finds its footing though, because hero shooters are fun and we need a bit more competition in the genre.

(I enjoy the game, hate the management. Leaving this review as negative so that it's known that they need to find a better approach to community work, because this is not the way. Community work is important to me as a community manager, and so I'm definitely going to be picky about it.)

Après avoir pu jouer à la beta dans un premier temps puis au jeux officiel pour résumer mon avis : Enfin !
Marvel Rivals est une bouffer d'air fraie dans un genre qui à du mal à se renouveler jusque alors dominer par Overwatch. Cependant se qui le différencie justement de son concurrent est bien au delà de pas prendre ces joueurs pour des imbéciles, nous avons l'intégralité des personnages jouable débloquer et se comme annoncer lors du développement de manière permanente. La boutique présente est juste pour des cosmétique qui est accessible même pour une personne ne souhaitant pas investir dans le jeu. Les personnages sont varié propose des combinaisons qui peuvent vous changez une partie.
J'ai pu lire quelque commentaire négatif au sujet du jeu et hors mis des personnes mécontente du succès de Rivals face à Overwatch 2 qui à du mal à garder ces joueurs, je répondrait simplement que si vous voulez comparez des héro shooter sachez que Overwatch n'est pas la référence la plus ancienne. Team Fortress classic et Team Fortress 2 sont bien implanter et on des base solide et non construit sur des promesses non tenu ou une envie de faire un maximum de chiffre.

Pour tout nouveau joueur je vous recommande de vous laissez du temps de bien comprendre votre héro, bien comprendre les mécanique du jeux et si vous le pouvez vous crée votre petite équipe pour réellement profiter d'une expérience inoubliable (Le discord du jeux regorge de joueur du monde entier).
DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS GAME IF YOU'RE STUDYING FOR ANY EXAMS. I'm having serious trouble with upcoming boards but... can't stop playing lol...

Genuinely fun, fast paced hero shooter. There's characters for all skill levels, a wide variety of maps, and a surprisingly respectful battle pass and currency system.

My only negatives are that there isn't any role lock, and that there are nearly 3x as many dps as supports and tanks in its current state. I really hope the game doesn't follow overwatch's mistakes in that regard.

The game itself is absolutely as fun as a hero shooter can be, it has everything Overwatch 2 should of had to be on top. Characters are nice, abilities are fun, gameplay is what we love, heroes are all unlocked, there are some free things you can acquire and so on. But the optimization, I just can't recommend the game right now because of it, I have a pretty okay pc, can play Overwatch really smoothly but this, even if I set everything to the lowest it can possibly ever go to the point where I can't even see it still drops to like 25 fps which is unplayable. Ill keep trying and I really hope they can fix the performance a little bit so we can all enjoy the game <3

Great game and great launch roster already, lots of characters to choose from with enough variety.

The core gameplay is similar to Overwatch, but the 3rd person perspective makes it feel really unique. It allows for more melee based characters and abilities, which is why the characters definitely feel different and fresh. They're going to be adding more heroes every season, so there's plenty to look forward to.

Graphics are great, unreal engine 5 does not disappoint. People have been complaining about performance, but I honestly haven't had any issues. I do have a pretty beefy rig, but overall this has been the smoothest launch I've experienced in quite some time.

The balancing will be key, and we have yet to see how proactive the devs will be in regard to that. They did make a lot of minor and major changes since both playtests though, things the community has asked for, so that makes me feel hopeful.

Monetization seems very fair. Skins are ~$20 and the battle pass is $10 (only $5 right now cause Season 0 is only half a season). You can earn some points ingame for free as well that allows you to purchase 1 or maybe 2 skins I believe.

Honestly would just recommend anyone who's on the fence to at least try it out since it's free anyway.

absolutely great game would recomend

Pros:
1. Great game a lot of heroes to start with none behind a pay wall
2. Game play is fun fast paced
3. Art style is great giving a lot of respect to comic books
4. Partner system is really cool ( allows certain heroes to gain an extra ability when they are paired with other certain heroes )
5. Heroes have pretty extensive kits some simple some complex
6. The game provides full video examples and descriptions of all abilities to help further understand what they do and how they should be used
7. A lot of Heroes/villains who aren't considered popular were still considered and given love like: Jeff the land Shark, The Punisher, Squirrel Girl, Moon Knight, ect.

Cons:
1. Game currently is a RAM hog. 16GB is not good despite it being recommended and likely Ryzen 5 CPUs will not be able to keep up as well given the fact that I'm running a Ryzen 7 5700x with 16GB of RAM and while playing my RAM and CPU usage is almost completely maxed out resulting in a good amount of frame lag and drops while playing. This is likely just poor optimization and maybe within a update or two can be resolved. I know Marvels
Avengers had a similar issue when that was released.

2. Audio queues such as hero abilities needs some work the only distinct things you can really hear are heroes shouting their ultimate voice lines everything from gunfire, basic abilities, ect. all just blend in together. This just helps with overall game play experience and allow players to use game information to manage their plays.

3. No role queue mode. This is obviously subjective but just like Overwatch without a role queue you're going to run into an issue where everyone just wants to play a DPS hero and no one wants to play a support or tank which often results in your team getting rolled because you don't have assistance from other roles. again this is purely personal preference on my part.

4. Minor thing. When talking in game chat via mic there doesn't seem to be a display anywhere to show you who on your team is speaking. This just helps when a player is requesting help they don't need to say "I'm X hero and X hero is on me"


Over all 1000% recommend the game it feels like a lot of love was put into it and respect for players and cant wait for future updates.

Rewards are basically them mocking f2p players with collectibles and comic covers, whole purpose of achievements are showcasing a players milestones already, we don't need dumb collectibles this is not an openworld rpg or sth. , other games actually reward players with skins, avatar frames etc. with higher frequency.

Melee duelists are lackluster compared to their ranged counterparts. Most melee duelists are either too slow, too fragile or both with lower dmg output compared to their ranged counterparts. If you want to put flankers in your game you need to give them the toolkit to survive going in; give them enough mobility or endurance to survive once they are in the backlines or you know give them enough damage to take someone out. If your melee duelists are supposed to be offtanks same issue; no hp pool, no proper skills for mitigating damage etc. Numerically they have higher hp than ranged duelists but in practice they only take one more hit before going down. For example; Wolverine moves like truck with flat tires, hits like a child slapping your wrist and as expected from a melee duelist has laughable hp. Healing factor and berserker rage my ass. What is he suppossed to do? Offtank with that hp and cd dependent ♥♥♥♥♥♥ healing factor? Flank enemy team with his low mobility, low dmg, one short distance charge attack and one janky af leap?

For the whole skill issue argument: No, if enemy team is even slightly aware of their surroundings your "flanker" melee duelists will do ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ once they move in and start hitting supports or snipers cuz people you try to "burst" with your laughable dmg will be healed and you will be shotdown instantly with your low endurance/mobility, your death will only serve to disrupt their positioning for a bit. Melee duelists offer little reward for high risk plays, meanwhile your ranged counterparts can shoot across the map with higher dmg, face less risk and get constant heals from their healers. Great balancing.

Even though it's a pretty fun game the optimization is crap.
After 3-5 games it crashes giving a supposed "GPU error".
This happens to most players even though having a high end pc.

+ Wysoka szybkość gry i zaskakująco dużo postaci posiadających potężne zdolności ruchowe czy nawet nielimitowany lot

+ Spora część otoczenia jest zniszczalna, a na wiele dachów budynków da się dostać zdolnościami ruchowymi w przeciwieństwie do Overwatcha gdzie z większości budynków się ześlizgujesz

+ Zaskakująco duża liczba (33) bohaterów na start, w dodatku wszyscy są odblokowani za darmo

+ Każda z postaci ma fajny gameplay, a sporo z nich ma zaskakująco wysoki skill ceiling

+ Ładny styl graficzny, zarówno w przypadku designu postaci jak i map. Bardzo fajne są też animowane artworki w trakcie ekranów wczytywania

+ Również nie najgorszy jak na grę multiplayer soundtrack

+ Jeff

+ Battle passy kosztują tylko 5$ (około 20 zł), a po kupnie zostają się w twojej kolekcji dzięki czemu możesz odblokować nagrody z nich po kilku nawet po kilku miesiącach jeżeli nie odblokowałeś wszystkiego w sezonie w jakim ten battle pass był aktywny

+ Ciekawy system umiejętności Team-Up, który daje bohaterom dodatkowe umiejętności/bonusy gdy są ze sobą w jednej drużynie...

-...jednak jedna z postaci w takim Team-Up'ie zawsze będzie dostawać mniej ciekawą rzecz od pozostałych. Ta jedna postać (nazwijmy ją dowódcą drużyny) daje buffy/dodatkową zdolność innej (albo dwóm innym). Sam dowódca jednak otrzymuje jedynie lekkie, pasywne zwiększenie obrażeń/leczenia albo trochę dodatkowego HP co nie zachęca wystarczająco mocno do wybrania go tylko i wyłącznie w celu stworzenia takiej kombinacji. Właśnie przez to, ludzie w drużynach złożonych z randomów prawie nigdy nie odpowiedzą na prośby o zagranie daną postacią (a jeśli juz o tym mówimy to bardzo fajnie, że na ekranie wyboru postaci jest system pingowania bohatera, którego chcemy mieć w drużynie). Z drugiej strony, danie tej postaci nowej zdolności mogłoby uczynić team-upy przesadnie overpowered i byłyby one konieczne jeśli ktoś chce wygrać więć ciężko jest mi podać idealne rozwiązanie tego problemu. Mimo wszystko, sam system Team-Up uważam za bardzo dobry i wyróżniający Marvel Rivals na tle konkurencji.

- Optymalizacja nadal trochę kuleje, fps-y potrafią spaść w trakcie większych teamfight'ów na niektórych mapach

- Gra nie zapisuje opcji zmiany języka na polski więc albo gramy po angielsku, albo przy każdym uruchomieniu musimy to zmieniać

+- Lagi w trakcie meczu oraz problemy przy zalogowaniu się przy włączaniu gry. Nie wiem czy to wina mojego internetu czy serwerów więc na razie nie klasyfikuję tego jako zaletę ani wadę

Após jogar por 5 horas, posso compartilhar minha opinião: o jogo é ótimo para passar o tempo e bastante divertido, especialmente por permitir criar combos com os personagens da Marvel. Ele é, de certa forma, uma cópia de *Overwatch*, mas com os heróis da Marvel, o que é uma ideia muito boa. A inspiração no *hero shooter* da Blizzard é um ponto positivo. O único problema que encontrei foi a otimização: os gráficos são bem semelhantes aos de um jogo de PlayStation 4, mas o jogo não consegue manter os 60 FPS estáveis nem nas configurações médias ou baixas, o que resulta em quedas de desempenho. Além disso, o jogo já travou algumas vezes. Mesmo com uma configuração modesta, que é funcional, ele não roda de forma ideal. Quando melhorar o desempenho talvez mude minha opinião.

I really really wanted to like this game. The game itself seems like it could be fun. after they patch in some much needed balance and quality of life updates...MOSTLY THE F-ING NETWORK ISSUES. IF YOU DONT HAVE THE SERVER SPACE OR WORKING CONNECTION TO SUPPORT A MASSIVE ONLINE FREE TO PLAY GAME WHY DO YOU HAVE LEAVING PENALTIES FOR PEOPLE WHO ARENT EVEN LEAVING. I CAN TELL I GOT DC'D EVERY GAME CAUSE IT WONT SHOW LOADING PERCENTAGE OR SAYS PRESS SPACE TO SKIP AND DOES NOTHING. LIKE OMG...I'VE NEVER HAD SO MANY DC ISSUES AS I'VE HAD ON THIS GAME. I ASSURE ITS NOT MY NETWORK AND MY INTERNET CONNECTIONS ARE NOT POOR. YOUR GAMES CREATORS MINDS MAYBE, NETWORKING IT STAFF.......ALSO POOR IN THE BRAIN. LITERALLLY SPENT 8 HOURS GETTING MULTI BANS FOR 5 - 15 MINS FOR LEAVING A GAME I NEVER LEFT. IT DC'D ME. THEN WHEN RECONNECTING TOLD ME THE SPOT HAD BEEN FILLED. THEN LETS ME REJOIN A NEWER GAME ONLY TO FINISH AND TELL ME I LEFT EARLY IN MY LAST MATCH AND WILL RECIEVE A PENALTY BAN. EVEN DURING GAMEPLAY THE LAG SOMETIMES IN INTENSIVE FIGHTS...IDK IF PEOPLE ARE DDOS ATTACKING OR WHAT, BUT OMG.............FOR A 2GB INTERNET CONNECTION THIS GAME SURE DOES SEEM TO BE CONNECTING THROUGH BACK CHANNELS ON DIAL UP OR SOMETHING. I cannot even being to express how I WILL NEVER BUY OR SPEND MONEY ON THIS GAME BECAUSE OF THESE REASONS. THE MAIN SIMPLE ONE. I CANNOT PLAY YOUR GAME AS INTENDED BECAUSE YOUR GAME DOES NO WORK AS INTENDED. ITS LITERALLY AN OVERWATCH COPY WITH LESS SUPPORT. OVERWATCH START WITH A PAID GAME THE FIRST GO SO THEY HAD THE MONEY TO IMMEDIATELY FIX MANY ISSUES.. NOW THE FREE TO PLAY ONE IS CHEATER INFESTED. AND AFTER 8 HOURS PLAYING THIS........LITERALLY SO IS THIS GAME. YOUR ANTI CHEAT LOADING POP UP BOX IS LITERALLY A JOKE. YOU CAN SEE THE SNAPPING AND AIMBOTTING IN KILL CAMS.

AGAIN I WANTED TO LOVE THIS GAME BUT IT HAS ALREADY STRUCK A CORD IN MY NERVE. THE LOW VISIBILITY ON ENEMY VS ALLY. OMG SOMETIMES PEOPLE ARE RUNNING AWAY FROM ME AND TRYING TO SHOOT AT ME AND IM ON THEIR TEAM. ITS JUST THAT BAD WITH VISIBILITY AS FAR AS RED OUTLINES. THEN EVERYONES GOT A HEALTH BAR ABOVE THEIR HEAD COVERING MOST OF THE ACTION. UGH. I COULD GO ON BUT I DIGRESS

IF YOU WANT AN OVERWATCH ALTERNATIVE THIS IS IT.
IF YOU WANTED HIGH QUALITY GRAPHICS AND HIGH FIDELITY GAME PLAY.......THIS IS NOT IT. ITS A COMIC GRAPHIC 3D MAKE. IDK WHAT UNREAL ENGINE 5 WAS EVEN USED FOR.....MAYBE THE SPELLS.....CAUSE NOT THE PLAYER SKINS.

Tô gostando muito do jogo, ele é divertido, tem uma arte linda, tem um sistema de monetização bom, só que tem muito o que melhorar. Desde coisas básicas, como não poder denunciar players, até a má otimização do jogo. O jogo ainda tem o que melhorar. Não sei se consigo dizer que é melhor que o Overwatch, porém não preciso ficar 20 minutos na fila para uma ranked. Gostaria de abrir pauta para um erro muito chato que tá acontecendo comigo: do nada, as texturas do jogo somem e fica tudo embaçado, só fechando e abrindo de novo para voltar. Também falo por amigos meus que usam HD; o jogo deles fica no 99% mó tempão, o que atrapalha muito para jogar partida rápida, já que eles ficam praticamente AFK durante uns 2 a 3 minutos. Isso é uma parada que, se um dos caras da otimização sentar para resolver, eles vão fazer em 5 minutos. Parece que os caras não querem mais fazer jogo para HD. Pelo menos, nas ranqueadas tem que esperar todos carregarem para jogar, então é mais suave.

Dito isso, recomendo o jogo e entendo que a temporada 0 é um teste deles para localizar e combater todos esses erros. Podemos esperar um jogo completamente diferente na temporada 1.

I've been part of the beta playtest and I must say it's so good to have a proper team based hero shooter like OW.
This game is a fresh air while still letting you apply all the theory you've learnt from past experiences.

This games deserve to boost this FPS genre, after what activision/blizzard did to the overwatch community !
I hope both game could live, and create some competition between each other which is very good for us players.

However major downside of this game so far :
Netcode is not as polish as overwatch even if it's better than the beta (Battle(none)sense do an analysis video please !)
Performance wise it's a very heavy game, it doesn't run at more than 150 on my 2080 SUPER i9 9900K at 1080p Low preset. In some areas/maps it just drops, and ofc the Doctor Stanger portal which just destroy any PC.
Visual/Audio queues/feedbacks are not that great (maybe I need to get used to it after 8 years of OW GUI)

Overall it's still a massive W for :
UX menu experience








In fact they have everything overwatch had after many years of dev (expect role queue),.
They just need not to make players far away from you, move smoothly and not like they have a 3 frames per seconds animation.

Плюсы:
***СУПЕР ПЛЮС* наконец то нормальные персонажами с большими жопами))
1)Разнообразие героем.
2)Большое количество карт.
3)Быстрота матчей и скорость подбор игроков на старте (1-2 секунды).
4)Кросплей.
Минусы:
1)Уже надоевший всем мультяшный визуальный стиль, который еще и весьма требовательный к железу.

3)Донат скины имеют космическую цену.

The Game is good, copying mechanics, game objectives, achievements etc. from overwatch and that's ok, it has potential but I feel like there are still some issues to fix that overwatch or paladins dont have. Hitboxes and the "attack" system as a whole feels off. There are no clear outlines for heroes and the crosshairs (even though customizable) they are way off for certain characters which makes it hard to aim unlike overwatch. I think there are also some graphics issues to be fixed on maps and objective goals, they are not clearly outlined (outlining and hitboxes are crucial in these games), also a better outline of the map or a minimap with what the destructible terrain outlined (didnt notice if there is one) would make it more special and stand out as a game.

In my humble opinion - I think there is room to grow with great potential but it's not entirely complete and sharp which makes it too early for release, then again who am I to judge

Absolute gem of a game

Many of the reviews are being very generous with this game because many are unsatisfied with what Overwatched has becomed (me being one of them), but being very honest, this game lacks many of the things that still make Overwatch playable:

-The game is poorly balanced, maybe because they rushed to have +30 characters in their roster, which makes for some characters unfair to play or others to have on your team.
-Movement animations and mechanics feel unpolished, which feels very awkward on how some players fly or others climb walls.
-At least an 80% of the game is unashamed of immitating something on Overwatch (Magneto is a Copy-paste of Sigma, StarLord is a salad of Tracer, Reeper and Soldier, among many other etceteras), and it isn't even well copied, which makes it feel like a waterdown version of the game.
-Very buggy and poorly optimized.

The good stuff:
-A lot of fan service not only for people watched the movies, but for some who also read the comics.
-Complementing the point above, there are skins that appeared on some media (comic, movies, etc)
-Fun to play. Overwatch is built over a great concept, which makes even a cheap imitation enjoyable.

and that's what you need to know before jumping into this game

Marvel Rivals is such a fun game! The matches are quick and exciting, and the mix of strategy with Marvel’s iconic characters makes it a blast to play.

Don't let the near four hours play time fool you, as I've maybe only spent about 45 minutes to an hour actually playing the game. The game will consistently freeze, forcing you to do a hard restart on your system. After restarting your system, you will promptly be told that you will be penalized for leaving a match early. Second critical error, getting stuck on network diagnostics screen before you even enter the game. I can't even access the main menu without getting soft locked into having my "connection fail, rerun diagnostics". I pay for gigabyte internet, on an ethernet connection. My global ping according to your diagnostics is 15, and yet that's not enough to run? For the rare moments were this game worked two days ago, it was fun. For now, its just a "Press the power button on your pc" simulator.

I had been waiting for a game like this my entire life. I spent my whole childhood watching super hero animes and TV shows. I used to collect Spider Man and Batman toys. all my T shirts had super hero pics on em. and if u look at my drawings I drew nothing but Super heroes.

so yeah living in a fantasy world and being a hero was always my biggest dream and I knew there's no way to fulfill that dream unless they make a game like this.

Now that I get a chance to play it I gotta say it's pretty impressive. gameplay is fast and fluid. Characters are hot and beautiful. there's also a lotta diversity, u have a character for every taste. there are also free premium skins. the graphics look gorgeous etc etc. everything seems great on paper.

but I can't recommend this game to anyone. because this is sooooo team based. if u are a solo player u will have a hard time. when u are fighting against a team that they're in party and can communicate to each other, this game becomes a nightmare.

they heal each other, support each other, they have a game plan, they can talk to each other, but you...???
u are just stuck with some randoms that each one of em goes a separate way. u die 5 seconds after u respawn cuz enemies are camped right behind the spawn gate and in the end ur team loses with 0 score.

if u have a friend and you guys support each other this is gonna be a blast but having a fiend is scarce and most people play solo nowadays so this is not a game for everyone.

Worth a laugh, but dont get invested
Some of the most washed up and toxic members of the overwatch community decided to set up shop in here. Honestly they can stay here. it's a ocean wide and inch deep hero shooter with *heavy* monitization. Nobody wants to be a tank, even fewer want to be a healer. It takes roughly 3 to 4 hours of playtime to even unlock the joke of a ranked system. While some of the maps are balanced. quite a few of them feel Heavily leaned to one team or the other. In the hours i've played it, there have been several maps, Like the sybiote world, Defenders have never won. All the while your teammates will flame you for not healing them when they are playing an assassin character across the map.
The whole game is balanced like a tumble dryer with a brick in it. Scarlet Witch's ult can wipe an entire team. Jeff the shark can gobble the team, run off a cliff and cause a team wipe with literally no way to escape it. Nobody knows you can shoot moon knight's ankhs because they do AOE damage and get worse the more there are.
If you're coming here from Overwatch 2, Do yourself a favor and do not get too invested. It's not worth putting money in and it *CERTAINLY* is not worth dedication of learning the systems. They are flimsy and i doubt this game will last.

TL:DR
Extremely toxic community. Joke of a Ranked system. Nobody wants to play anything other than DPS. Balanced like a tumbedryer with a brick in it.

Dont get invested. Just go back to the one you're used to. I doubt this will stick around long.

Yeni çıktığı için tabii eksikleri var fakat şu anki haliyle bile bana gayet eğlenceli geldi. Marvel karakterlerini, çoğu karaktere özgü farklı oynanış stiliyle deneyimlemek güzeldi. Oyunda şu anlık sadece 3 adet mod bulunuyor ve haritalarda az. Tabii ilerleyen zamanda güncellemelerle oyun çeşitlenecektir diye düşünüyorum. Karakterlerde oldukça fazla dengesizlik var, bazılarına nerf ve buff getirilmeli. Oyunda Türkçe dil desteğinin bulunması güzel fakat keşke yerel fiyatlandırma da yapsalarmış, sadece bir paket almak için 25 dolar ödemeniz gerekiyor. Genel olarak Marvel Rivals potansiyel vaat eden bir oyun, özellikle Gameplay kısmı oldukça başarılı. Şu ana kadar pek benzer türde oyunlar oynamadım fakat Marvel evrenine ilginiz varsa deneyim etmenizi öneririm.

Marvel Rivals is incredible! Everything about it is fun and engaging—the maps, the heroes, and the gameplay are just amazing. The launch has been exceptionally smooth with no server issues, and matchmaking is instant, making it easy to jump into the action.

One of the best parts is that we get access to all the heroes without being locked behind a paywall, which is a huge win. I really hope they keep it that way.

The cosmetic shop is also fantastic, offering amazing skins that add even more excitement to the game. Honestly, the list of positives just keeps going!

If you haven’t tried Marvel Rivals yet, you’re missing out. I’m not usually one to write reviews, but this game definitely deserves it!

This game's presentation is absolutely perfect.
I just love how this game looks. I also love the "high-tech" approach they took to most re-designs.
As much as I hate the MCU, I genuinely love these heroes because you can't deny characters like Venom are extremely cool.
The majestic animation trailers along with a cheesy yet, oddly moving main theme had me hooked. For real, this song gave chills. I don't think I've seen the comic book art style done this beautifully since Marvel Vs. Capcom 3. The nanosecond I saw Psylocke I knew I had to play it.
While OW2 is content wringing their playerbase dry with $700 skins and limited time battlepasses, Marvel Rivals has already confirmed that every battle pass you purchase will be available to complete forever. Though I'm not too happy with the 16 - 20 dollar skins but the game is free so I guess I can't be too mad about it.
One thing I don't like at all is the battlepass progression is locked behind completing missions but these can be done vs bots so I guess it could be worse.

The game is so much fun! It has so many great features, like the hero team-up abilities, the faction systems, having tournaments built directly into the game, and of course all of the lore of the heroes in the game. If you're a marvel fan, or a hero shooter fan, you most likely will like this game. It can be a bit chaotic at times, but once you get used to the chaos it isn't so bad. The most impressive thing, which is sad to say this is impressive, it should be the standard, the servers have been amazing, even with almost half a million player at launch, I haven't had a single issue with logging into the game, dealing with queues or matchmaking. The longest queue I've waiting in for a match was 16 seconds. I'd highly recommend this game as it is so much fun!
